I will do this by emphasizing the fact that life at its most fundamental level
is irreducibly complex and that such complexity is incompatible with undi-
rected evolution.
A Series of Eyes
How do we see?
In the 19th century the anatomy of the eye was known in great detail and
the sophisticated mechanisms it employs to deliver an accurate picture of
the outside world astounded everyone who was familiar with them. Scien-
tists of the 19th century correctly observed that if a person were so unfor
